content: I don't agree with the disposition of this tsak - it would be better to add some property to the test, so that testing frameworks can decide whether the test applies or not
I'm happy with the rest of the dispositions

Hmmm.... so I updated the disposition on this one, but I agree with the statement that the "test is more restrictive than the spec". If an engine refuses to evaluate .children().skip(), isn't that engine non-compliant?
I think that if an engine doesn't return things in order, it should be allowed to refuse to do skip on the unordered list without being called non-compliant
That's reasonable, but then the spec should allow for that.
In addition, add a note to the specification that implementations may return an error when an attempt is made to perform an order-dependent operation on an unordered list.
ok. I second the block vote now
